page.title: 12Little Heath _ General
page.content: Little Heath on the edge of Potters Bar, has a closely knit community with both old and young integrating happily together. Newer families have moved into the area so that the parents commute into London for their work. The village enjoys a pleasant heath top site with Christ Church occupying the highest point between London and York. The Church and the school play a prominent part in the life of the community. Osborne House, Leggets Park and the Royal Veterinary College reflect the historical development of Little Heath from country estate to a national centre of learning.
